566,"WN280","Mapping","A [pull request](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/pull/2841) to the iD editor by Bryan Housel makes it possible that aerial images better than Bing are now displayed as default instead of Bing. Up to now, users had to switch manually from Bing to the better local aerial image provider. A comment by Mateusz Konieczny [explains](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/1310#issuecomment-46619171) why this is important. The modification will be rolled out at osm.org with the next iD release.",7

1022","WN288","Programming","By releasing version 1.7.5-idio.intel.lawyers, iD Editor has [changed](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/commit/71c8b5f0a8afc927104ffd47bc79fe7898d57088) its license from WTFPL (Do What The Fuck You Want Public License) to ISC license (similar to BSD license). iD developers integrated code from Intel but Intel lawyers did not want to publish the code unter WTFPL.",7

column1: 1025,"WN288","Mapping","Users Hakuch has opened a [proposal](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Proposed_features/Remove_suffixed_name-tags_from_wiki) to ""Remove suffixed name tag from wiki"". ` name_1` and `alt_name_1` should no longer  be described in the [wiki](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:name) and thus not be a feature of iD editor any more. The voting  runs until 2016-02-08.",7

1205,"WN291","Maps","Adam Franco published a tool, [Curvature](https://github.com/adamfranco/curvature/wiki), which analyzes the geometry (curve radii) of roads in OSM and produces color-coded [world-wide KML overlays](http://www2.adamfranco.com/curvature/kml/) that motorcyclists and other driving enthusiasts can use to identify the most twisty roads and plan trips. Incomplete coverage of surface=  tags on road ways is a challenge in some regions as small unpaved roads are often the twistiest. To help improve the OSM data, ID and JOSM-control links are provided for each road allow users to quickly jump to un-tagged ways.",7

1217,"WN291","Programming","Andrew [notes](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/dev/2016-February/029072.html) that we're approaching 4 billion nodes. 32 bit unsigned integers will not be useable for storing node IDs soon. 32 bit signed integers have been too short since 9. February 2013.",7

3105,"WN326","Humanitarian OSM","Severin Menard [initiates](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/hot/2016-October/012536.html) a discussion about necessary improvements to the Tasking Manager to combat the problem of ""crappy newbie edits"" of humanitarian mappers. 3118,"WN326","Imports","Statistics Canada, the national statistical office, [started](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk-ca/2016-October/007430.html) a crowdsourcing project in collaboration with the local OSM community on Monday to collect information such as geometry, height etc. for non-residential buildings using a modified iD editor. Before and during the launch, three users [imported](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk-ca/2016-October/007416.html) buildings and addresses in Ottawa, but sadly [failed to comply](https://www.openstreetmap.org/changeset/42633517#map=11/45.3385/-76.1526) with the [import guidelines](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Import/Guidelines), [debated](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk-ca/2016-October/007452.html) enforcement of it, and engaged in [edit warring](https://www.openstreetmap.org/changeset/42988442). 4514,"WN356","Imports","Ilya Zverev has suggested importing Shell petrol stations (initially in the UK) on the [Import](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/imports/2017-May/004956.html) and [talk-gb](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk-gb/2017-May/020216.html) lists. 9547,"WN462","Community","Tense discussions about iD and the legitimation of the iD maintainers to unilaterally decide mapping questions such as the implementation of new tags without the OSM community resurfaced following the widely, on [GitHub](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/6409), OSM's [tagging mailing list]( https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/tagging/2019-May/thread.html#45462) and the [general mailing list](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2019-May/thread.html#82538) disputed decision to implement a validation rule asking to add `highway=footway` to `railway/public_transport=platform`.

The disputes followed shortly after the invention of `nosquare=yes` to ""resolve all unsquare way issues"" which was also widely challenged on [GitHub](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/6332) and the [general mailing list](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2019-May/thread.html#82506).

During the discussion some ideas like an iD fork or potential policies for developers were raised. Unfortunately the discussions escalated and led the iD maintainer Bryan Housel to [lock a ticket](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/6409#issuecomment-495231649) in GitHub which was seen as rant by others and led [SomeoneElse](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/SomeoneElse) to [submit](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/6442) a code of conduct complaint about the used comment.

The discussion spilled over to the mailing list of the OSM Foundation, where Christine Karch [offered](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/osmf-talk/2019-May/006068.html) a slot at the upcoming SotM on 21–23 September 2019, an offer [declined](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/osmf-talk/2019-May/006069.html) by iD's key maintainer Bryan Housel.",7

9680,"WN465","Software","Frédéric Rodrigo has forked the iD editor and made the version available on [id.openstreetmap.fr](http://id.openstreetmap.fr). He has [reverted](https://github.com/frodrigo/iD/commits/compliance) some controversial,  much discussed, changes made in the main branch.",7

9760,"WN467","Mapping","A new iD feature, which adds Wikidata and Wikipedia tags for brands of retail chains, caused issues when restaurants with very similar names were tagged mistakenly, [according](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/6577) to a GitHub bug report. One proposed solution is to use the tag  `not:brand:wikidata=` to avoid the tag being added again. Quincy Morgan, one of the two iD maintainers, points to the approval process before introducing it.",7

9794,"WN468","Mapping","SilentSpike's [suggestion](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/6631) to implement a warning in iD when landuse is connected to highways was discussed and, as usual, there are diverse opinions..",7

9816,"WN468","Programming","iD users [may become](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/6616) able to change the style of the map in the editor. The iD maintainer Quincy Morgan calls the feature, which is similar to ""Map Styles"" in JOSM, ""Lenses"".",7

9818,"WN468","Releases","The iD team has released version v2.15.3 of the popular editor. The changes in the new version, which is already in use at osm.org, are [detailed](https://github.com/openstreetmap/openstreetmap-website/pull/2294) at GitHub.",7
9917,"WN470","Software","Russian OSM user AlexPS [created](https://userstyles.org/styles/173774/openstreetmap-dark-theme) a ""dark"" theme for the online editor iD.",7

9950,"WN471","Releases","Quincy Morgan [announced](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/rails-dev/2019-July/016355.html) the release of a new version of the OSM editor iD. Version v2.15.4 does not reuse the previous changeset comment by default anymore, indicates the direction of weirs and includes many other bugfixes, validation improvements, new localisations and additional presets.",7

9967,"WN472","Humanitarian OSM","Felix Delattre presented an [update](https://www.hotosm.org/updates/a-map-editor-for-the-tasking-manager/) on recent work being to improve the HOT Tasking Manager. A user experience survey was carried out in February and March to better understand how users used the software and how users were spending time within the software. Based on the results of the survey HOT plans to better integrate the Tasking Manager with iD in order to improve the experience for mappers and provide user instructions in one tool. This will allow mappers to report back from a task directly from inside the integrated iD editor. Integration also opens the way to dynamically populate the iD editor with tagging presets and specific validation rules depending on the map features that are requested by humanitarian organisations in each of the different projects.",7

10035,"WN473","Community","In last week's Pista ng Mapa conference, two sessions were about AI. First was a [lightning talk by Ardie Orden](https://twitter.com/arnalielsewhere/status/1157115191491829763) from Thinking Machines and their Map the Gap initiative, and then a [mapathon](https://twitter.com/maningsambale/status/1157126871403728896) session using Facebook's MapWithAI RapiD editor and HOTOSM's Tasking Manager for areas near the host city of Dumaguete.  During the conference closing activity,  the organisers announced a new initiative to leverage AI-assisted tools for identifying, prioritising, and mapping the road network of the Philippine countryside called [Tabang-AI](https://github.com/OSMPH/Tabang-AI/), a Cebuano word for collaboration, or to aid.",7

10084,"WN474","Community","Frederik Ramm has [suggested](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/pull/6752) prioritising OSM's own communication channels over other, externally controlled, ones in the iD user interface. The same issue was also [raised](https://github.com/osmlab/osm-community-index/issues/114) by Joost Schouppe in the OSM Community Index project.",7

10122,"WN475","Releases","Version 2.15.5 of iD has been released. A list of the improvements can be found in the GitHub [comments](https://github.com/openstreetmap/openstreetmap-website/pull/2359).",7

10227,"WN478","Mapping","Microsoft's dataset with approximatley 125 million building footprints in the US is currently available in the RapiD editor as [an experimental feature](https://mapwith.ai/rapid-sotm2019). If you zoom into the USA you can see the suggested buildings and roads.
More background is available at the website for [RapiD](https://mapwith.ai/) and the GitHub page for the [building footprint dataset](https://github.com/Microsoft/USBuildingFootprints).",7

10330,"WN480","About us","Manfred Reiter presented a guide on how to publish OSM news via weeklyOSM during the recent SotM in Heidelberg. So if you are a mapper, data consumer or iD programmer and feel that some kind of news deserves attention, [here is a copy of the slides](https://www.slideshare.net/ofredao/osmbc-to-weeklyosm).",7

10392,"WN481","OpenStreetMap Foundation","The [minutes](https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Licensing_Working_Group/Minutes/2019-09-12) of the meeting of the Licensing Working Group on 12 September 2019 have been published. The topics were the Attribution Guideline, a guideline for machine learning with OSM data and a data leak from the iD editor that passes user data to Facebook.",7

10537,"WN484","Mapping","Mateusz Konieczny [filed](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/6962) an issue on GitHub for the iD editor to reverse the [disputed decision](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/tagging/2018-October/040245.html) of the iD maintainers to let the iD validator recommend replacing `crossing=zebra` with `crossing=marked`. This is a [particular issue](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/tagging/2018-October/040245.html) in the UK, where the tag originated, and where it has a precise legal meaning. The GitHub issue was closed and further comments were ignored.",7

10532,"WN484","Releases","The iD editor has been [updated](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/rails-dev/2019-October/017038.html) to v2.16.0. The release notes [highlight](https://github.com/openstreetmap/openstreetmap-website/pull/2413) support for objects which were detected in Mapillary images and you can track changes while editing. You can now use this version on the main map.",7

10582,"WN485","Education","The IDEAL-VGI project aims to focus on the challenges of volunteered geographic information for land use classification and big earth observation data. The project is a [collaboration](http://k1z.blog.uni-heidelberg.de/2019/11/04/new-dfg-project-idealvgi-deep-learning-with-osm/) between Heidelberg University’s GIScience Research Group and the Technical University of Berlin.",7

10561,"WN485","Mapping","StreetCred is a company founded by [Randy Meech](https://www.streetcred.co/about/team/randy-meech/) after MapZen folded. They now [provide](https://www.streetcred.co/blog/2019/10/28/using-streetcred-data-to-improve-openstreetmap/) their POI data with an MVT-Tileserver, which can be used in iD as an extra custom layer.",7

10611,"WN486","Community","Frederik Ramm [had it](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/woodpeck/diary/391175) with the behaviour of the iD development team. He thinks the relationship with OSM, which he calls ""abusive"", should come to an end. According to his post, the iD team has shown that decisions to implement features are not driven by what the community wants or needs but by the editor developers alone. Therefore, he recommends replacing the default osm.org editor iD with a fork using the [version](https://github.com/frodrigo/iD) from [Frédéric Rodrigo](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/frodrigo). A heated discussion ensued.",7

10600,"WN486","Community","The iD developers temporarily deactivated commenting on issues and pull requests, and the creation of new issues for everyone except collaborators. A few hours before, users [complained](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/7028) again about iD transferring user data, without consent,  to Facebook by loading brand logos.  It now appears possible for non-collaborators to raise issues again.",7

10618,"WN486","Mapping","Kreuzschnabel luckily [spotted](https://forum.openstreetmap.org/viewtopic.php?id=67927) ![(de)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/de.svg) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=https://forum.openstreetmap.org/viewtopic.php?id=67927)) a mass displacement of London roads, and quickly reverted the change. See various comments in the [Q&A forum](https://forum.openstreetmap.org/viewtopic.php?pid=768255#p768255). Among other suggestions, Richard Fairhurst suspected it might be a OSM file being opened which has the same OSM IDs as the nodes in London and Oslo.",7

10687,"WN487","Did you know that …","... that you can access the map features that have been extracted by Mapillary from its streetside imagery from iD? Mapillary [announced](https://twitter.com/mapillary/status/1194799297969016832) the new layer, which you can find in iD's map data tab.",7

10713,"WN488","Licenses","Guillaume Rischard warns that 308 imagery or map sources in the Editor Layer Index, an index for potential imagery and raster data background layers for OSM editors such as iD and JOSM, [have no known licence](https://github.com/osmlab/editor-layer-index/issues/439). Can you help find some of them?",7

10737,"WN489","Mapping","Road data in the [RapiD editor](https://mapwith.ai/rapid) are now available for [all countries](https://github.com/facebookmicrosites/Open-Mapping-At-Facebook/wiki/Available-Countries) of South America and Africa. The new release is fully integrated with Microsoft building footprints (>150M unmapped buildings in US, Tanzania and Uganda).",7

10922,"WN492","Releases","Quincy Morgan [announced](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/rails-dev/2019-December/017476.html) the updates to iD in v2.17.0. Other than improvements such as a single click function to add tunnels or bridges and the continued visibility of select features even when zoomed out, the release notes include some non-core changes like the addition of a privacy policy, the ability to opt out of icons loaded from third-party sites, the new [iD blog](https://ideditor.blog/) and the removal of Maxar imagery layers following the announced suspension of service.",7

10954,"WN493","Mapping","The German forum [discussed](https://forum.openstreetmap.org/viewtopic.php?id=68307) ![(de)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/de.svg) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=https://forum.openstreetmap.org/viewtopic.php?id=68307)) the ID editor's recommendation of the tag `secondary_entrance`  for building entrances. It turns out that the history of entrance tag values is complex; some, for instance, are influenced by the mapping of Cambridge University done in 2011.",7

10986,"WN494","Licenses","[Nuno Caldeira](https://twitter.com/iamnunocaldeira/status/1212424393441329152?s=19) and [Rob Nickerson](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk-gb/2020-January/024029.html) noticed Facebook's [release](https://github.com/facebookmicrosites/Open-Mapping-At-Facebook/wiki/Available-Countries) of new countries for [RapiD](https://mapwith.ai/). Facebook made 84 new countries available in their editor, which provides missing features, detected by artificial intelligence on imagery, to the users of RapiD who can then add the features to OSM.",7

11035,"WN495","Mapping","OSM User the_node_less_traveled [reported](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/the_node_less_traveled/diary/391863) about the MapWithAI plugin for JOSM, which allows JOSM users to work with the features detected by Facebook's recently introduced [MapWithAI](https://mapwith.ai/) tool. The tool is intended for users with an unstable internet connection or who don't want to use the iD editor derivative RapiD.",7

11078,"WN496","Releases","The OSM editor iD has been updated to version 2.17.1. The editor no longer supports Node 8 and requires at least Node 10 if you want to build the editor yourself. Other changes include the new ability to reorder fields with multiple values by drag-and-drop, usability improvements and [many more](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/rails-dev/2020-January/017711.html).",7

11050,"WN496","Mapping","Mapillary have [made](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/01/16/how-to-use-mapillary-point-data-in-openstreetmap-id.html) their map features available as a data layer in iD Editor. The layer contains point data which was extracted from imagery uploaded to Mapillary.",7

11253,"WN500","Did you know that …","... that the iD editor now has its own [blog](https://ideditor.blog/)? This blog covers feature releases, community news, and development insights from iD's maintainers and contributors.",7

11223,"WN500","Community","Shawna Bjorgan, of Arizona State University, [writes](https://www.youthmappers.org/single-post/2020/02/06/Interning-remotely-with-YouthMappers-USAID-GeoCenter) about her experience interning remotely with YouthMappers and the USAID GeoCenter on the YouthMappers blog.",7

11352,"WN502","Mapping","[Crossing Highways (roads) in India](https://server.nikhilvj.co.in/OSM/roads.html) is a map of spots in India where highways cross or overlap each other without sharing a node. Users can see details and click to open the same location in the OpenStreetMap iD editor to fix it. The map updates daily. It was created by processing the output of [OSMLint](https://github.com/osmlab/osmlint). The frontend map uses leaflet-simple-csv. Note: it may contain false positives such as pedestrian overbridges.",7

11427,"WN503","Community","Andy Mabbett [reminded](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2020-March/084260.html) us of a debate five years ago about the value of adding Wikidata IDs to OSM. Andy provides an example of the benefits of the link and asks others for their projects, which make use of both OSM and Wikidata.",7

11417,"WN503","Mapping","Martijn van Exel [introduced](https://map.bingo/2020/03/04/introducing-some-more-maproulette-quick-fix-challenges-lanes-drive-thrus/) a new type of MapRoulette Challenge, the Quick Fix. Unlike traditional MapRoulette Challenges, the new Quick Fix Challenges require no experience with OSM editing tools like JOSM or iD. MapRoulette asks you, the mapper, a question that just requires a simple yes/no answer.",7

11735,"WN511","Releases","Quincy Morgan [announced](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/rails-dev/2020-April/018418.html) the upgrade of the OSM editor iD to version v2.17.3. In a post to the openstreetmap-website mailing list he details the changes in the new version. The most important change is the new function to allow flagging places which are open during coronavirus lockdowns, along with special opening hours.",7

11800,"WN512","Humanitarian OSM","HOT [presented](https://www.hotosm.org/updates/tm4launch/) the new Tasking Manager. The improved frontend with integrated iD editor and mapping roles such as Validators, Mapper and Project Manager are intended to assist collaborative mapping.",7
11926,"WN515","Programming","Quincy Morgan, maintainer of the iD editor, is [thinking](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/7639) about releasing iD as a mobile app.",7

11997,"WN516","OpenStreetMap Foundation","Allan Mustard, chairman of the OSMF board, [came up](https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2020/06/08/toward-resolution-of-controversies-related-to-id/) with a proposal to improve the relationship between parts of the community and the developers of iD. It cites the often criticised tagging decisions of the iD team but goes much further. The proposal was published as a blog post and as a [mail](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2020-June/084859.html) to Talk and OSMF-Talk. Comments are explicitly requested. The proposal can also be applied to other developers and projects.",7

12145,"WN519","Did you know that …","… that RapiD, Facebook's iD fork to load automatically traced features into OSM, does not offer automatically traced features in [Iran](https://github.com/facebookincubator/RapiD/issues/58) and [North Korea](https://github.com/facebookincubator/RapiD/issues/130) because they are not allowed to do so under US sanctions?",7

12135,"WN519","Community","Bryan Housel, who [had been working](https://github.com/ideditor/imagery-index/issues/5) for Mapbox, now [works](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Bhousel) for [Kaart](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Kaart), a contractor of Apple and Facebook, on [RapiD](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/RapiD), a fork of iD which can import features automatically traced from satellite imagery into OSM.",7

12226,"WN521","OpenStreetMap Foundation","The [minutes](https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Board/Minutes/2020-06-11) of the non-public OSMF Board meeting on 11 June 2020 have been published. The agenda included the selection of Microgrant applicants, the membership application of a possible ODbL violator, and responses to the RFC on iD governance.",7

12286,"WN522","Mapping","Adamant36's [request](https://github.com/openstreetmap/openstreetmap-website/issues/2708) to add RapiD to the list of editors on the OSM map resulted in a robust discussion on GitHub.",7

12285,"WN522","Community","Deane Kensok [blogged](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Deane%20Kensok/diary/393610) about a partnership between Esri and Facebook to provide data from the ArcGIS user community to OSM. These [datasets](https://openstreetmap.maps.arcgis.com/home/group.html?id=bdf6c800b3ae453b9db239e03d7c1727#overview) are OSM-tagged, compatibly licensed, and available to use for building maps in RapID and JOSM (via a [plugin](https://gitlab.com/gokaart/JOSM_MapWithAI/-/wikis/Testing-the-development-version)).",7

12346,"WN523","Imports","Alex Hennings has [reviewed](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/blackboxlogic/diary/393721) Facebook and ESRI's proposed 'not-an-import' imports (we reported [earlier](http://weeklyosm.eu/archives/13430#wn522_22949)) of ArcGIS datasets through RapiD or JOSM MapWithAI plugin and found them wanting. Of particular concern was the lack of solicited community review on the [imports-us](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/listinfo/imports-us) mail list.",7

12306,"WN523","Humanitarian OSM","HOT is conducting an online [survey](https://forms.gle/naCB3CzuWqYMhQpJ8) of people who have used RapiD to find out what their experience was. The data will be used to understand how RapiD  could be made more accessible and usable for a variety of users.",7

12311,"WN523","Releases","With the release of the latest version of iD, the 'locator overlay', a semi-transparent overlay when zoomed out, [has been rebuilt](https://blog.mapbox.com/rebuilt-locator-overlay-for-id-editor-9606da7f18f8). Via the OpenStreetMap editor-layer-index, the new overlay is now available on OpenStreetMap.org, and soon on the HOT Tasking Manager and other instances of iD.",7

12319,"WN523","Releases","The iD editor was [updated](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/blob/release/CHANGELOG.md#2180) and now has [touch support](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/muramototomoya/diary/393733), so it can be used on tablets (smartphone sized screens aren’t fully supported yet). Other highlights are integrated quality checks and multi-selection editing.",7

12371,"WN524","OpenStreetMap Foundation","Mikel Maron [wrote](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2020-August/085206.html) an email about 'coordinated funding to support continued maintenance and development of the iD editor'.",7

12441,"WN525","OpenStreetMap Foundation","Mikel Maron is [asking](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/osmf-talk/2020-August/006997.html) for feedback about the funding of iD development and maintenance. Many people have [expressed](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/osmf-talk/2020-August/thread.html) their opinions.",7

12539,"WN527","Open Data","Mapillary [has announced](https://blog.mapillary.com/update/2020/08/24/global-map-features-openstreetmap.html) that computer vision extracted data is now available globally on OSM. Previously only traffic signs were available in JOSM, and other data was available by request in iD. Now data including pedestrian crossings (crosswalks), traffic lights, bicycle parking, and many other classes are available globally, thanks to image contributions from Mapillary users.",7

12605,"WN528","Mapping","OpenStreetMap hit [90 million changesets](https://www.openstreetmap.org/changeset/90000000). The changeset was done using RapiD by [Diana IRM-ED](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Diana%20IRM-ED), an Indonesian mapper paid by HOT.",7

12644,"WN530","Community","Allan Mustard, aka apm-wa, [published](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/apm-wa/diary/394167) a diary entry about his new camera setup for Mapillary imagery and the recent decisions of the OSMF Board about funding the development of OSM editors (namely iD, Potlatch and StreetComplete) and the hire of a full-time system reliability engineer.",7
12677,"WN530","Releases","iD [released](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/blob/release/CHANGELOG.md#2185) patch update 2.18.5 with changes from 12 contributors, seven of whom are new!",7

12696,"WN531","Software","Google is a heavy user of open source tools. They are using iD for the historical map project [Kartta Labs](https://github.com/kartta-labs/Project). Kartta Labs uses a customised version of iD, which lets everyone [draw](https://opensource.googleblog.com/2020/09/recreating-historical-streetscapes.html) the historical landscape of a city based on georeferenced old paper maps.",7

12945,"WN536","Programming","Guillaume Rischard, maintainer of the Editor Layer Index, [suggests](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/8086) abandoning the ELI and for iD to use the background layer list from JOSM (we have [covered](https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/12980#wn504_22103) previous discussions of this).",7

12933,"WN536","Programming","Erick de Oliveira Leal [explained](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/erickdeoliveiraleal/diary/394514) how to enable the Strava High Resolution Layer in OpenStreetMap (JOSM or ID). __Editor's note:__ Please note that when you are using this Strava layer there is, at present, no permission to use this layer for OSM and you run the risk of having your edits removed.",7
13008,"WN537","Releases","Quincy Morgan [reported](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/rails-dev/2020-November/020125.html) the updates to iD  in v2.19.4 (#2931).",7

13145,"WN541","Programming","The tagging templates and tag validation rules of iD have been moved to a separate GitHub project called [iD Tagging Schema](https://github.com/openstreetmap/id-tagging-schema).",7

13374,"WN546","Releases","Bryce Cogswell  [announced](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/bryceco/diary/395242) that the latest release of GoMap!! (2.0.7) is available at the iOS App Store. This release includes some substantial new features, including greatly extended presets (using the Name Suggestion Index and iD presets), dark mode, and an updated user interface. Of particular significance is support for a number of languages beyond the original English.",7

13584,"WN550","Did you know that …","... OSGeoLive [provides](https://live.osgeo.org/en/metrics.html) project development statistics for open GIS products? In each case the activity, the programming language, and the development team is given with statistics over the whole development time. ID Editor is represented; JOSM unfortunately has [problems](https://www.openhub.net/p/josm/enlistments) on Open Hub.",7

13984,"WN560","Did you know that …","... if you feel bored during the lockdown, [ImproveOsm](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/JOSM/Plugins/ImproveOsm) can help by pointing to probable missing features for you to map? The tool exists both as a plug-in for JOSM and as an iD layer.",7

14071,"WN562","OpenStreetMap Foundation","Quincy Morgan and the OpenStreetMap Foundation’s Board [made](https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2021/04/26/joint-statement-from-quincy-morgan-and-the-osmf-board/) a joint statement on Quincy's plan to leave the iD project. They will work together to choose and mentor an iD project successor.",7

14226,"WN566","OpenStreetMap Foundation","The minutes of the last OSM Board meeting are now [available online](https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Board/Minutes/2021-05-14). Amongst the topics discussed were: a possible move of the Foundation, as a legal entity, out of the UK; the restart of the Engineering Working Group; the banking situation; iD development; and hiring a site reliability engineer.",7

14326,"WN569","OpenStreetMap Foundation","The OpenStreetMap Foundation is currently [looking for a developer](https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2021/06/15/apply-to-maintain-and-develop-id/) to maintain and develop the iD editor.",7

14406,"WN571","Did you know that …","... Erick De Oliveira Leal has a [tutorial](https://erickdeoliveiraleal.medium.com/tutorial-strava-openstreetmap-josm-or-id-2e2003f4aea3) on using the Strava high resolution layer for OpenStreetMap (JOSM or iD)?",7

14412,"WN571","Software","After a [test run](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/escallic/diary/397067), user Escallic recommends mapping curved features by tracing with a mouse or a suitable touch gesture. To enable this they have released an open source patch for the iD editor. To avoid overloading drag operations this is enabled in-editor as a distinct mode.",7

14524,"WN574","Mapping","If you map in Washington state it would be worthwhile reading jake-low's diary [entry](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/jake-low/diary/397224) on how to use the Department of Natural Resources LiDAR in iD.",7

14545,"WN575","OpenStreetMap Foundation","In the context of maintenance of the iD editor, former maintainer, Bryan Housel [made](https://twitter.com/bhousel/status/1418797043699572743) some strong allegations regarding change of maintainer.",7

column1: 14958,"WN587","Mapping","Mapillary's change from API version 3 to 4 has apparently resulted in changed photo IDs, which had been tagged in OSM on some objects with [`mapillary= `](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:mapillary). There is a discussion on the tagging mailing list about how to handle the tag in the future. Mateusz Konieczny [proposes](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/tagging/2021-October/062637.html) abolishing the tag if a changeover is not possible.",7

15007,"WN588","Software","Bryan Housel [announced](https://twitter.com/bhousel/status/1452806915151605762/photo/1) the release of RapiD [1.1.8](https://github.com/facebookincubator/RapiD/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#118), which includes performance improvements and bugfixes.",7

15021,"WN589","Imports","Kai Poppe [has outlined](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Kmpoppe/Automated_Edits/Mapillary_Update), on the wiki, preparations for  an automated edit to update `mapillary` tags made obsolete by a software update (as we [reported](https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/14930#wn587_25739) earlier). The plan is to update all `mapillary` tags from the old 22-character form to the new  numeric IDs of version 4. The Wiki page will be used to track current statistics and any further plan of action.
There was also a [MapRoulette challenge](https://maproulette.org/browse/challenges/23278) that sought to clean up all the invalid values, but it is now complete.",7

15076,"WN590","Did you know that …","... the [polygon extractor](https://polygons.openstreetmap.fr/) of OSM France? This tool allows you to download OSM relations as GeoJSON, image and other formats based on the relations' ID.",7

15078,"WN590","Programming","Martin Raifer (user [tyr_asd](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/tyr_asd/)), the new iD developer contracted by OSMF, [introduced himself](https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2021/11/05/self-introduction-of-the-new-id-developer/).",7

15452,"WN601","Releases","Martin Raifer released an update of iD's tagging presets: Version 3.2.0 includes a lot of improvements, new presets and fields, as well as bug fixes and translation updates. Notable changes are the update of the parcel lockers preset to the new `amenity=parcel_locker` tag, and the addition of a preset for `crossing=traffic_signals`. See the [changelog](https://github.com/openstreetmap/id-tagging-schema/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#320) for the full list of changes.",7

15517,"WN603","Releases","The iD editor was recently updated from 2.20.2 to 2.20.4, including various improvements such as security fixes, improvements to screen reader accessibility, enhanced preservation of the history of OSM objects, bugfixes and more. See the [changelog](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/blob/develop/CHANGELOG.md#2203) for the full list of changes. This version of iD will be the last to support Internet Explorer 11.",7

15820,"WN611","Events","Bryan Housel [presented](https://nitter.net/bhousel/status/1510053741025656835) the 2.0 alpha of the new RapiD at SotMUS. The test instance [shows](https://mapwith.ai/rapid-sotm-2022) high performance during tests.",7

15878,"WN613","Software","Anton Khorev [wrote](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Anton%20Khorev/diary/398991), in his diary, about his note-viewer and integrating it with JOSM and iD to allow editing.",7
15904,"WN614","Mapping","Anton Khorev has [devised](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Anton%20Khorev/diary/399067) a workaround for viewing notes in iD by remote control.",7
15946,"WN615","Community","mapmeld [wrote](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/mapmeld/diary/399076) up his activity summary for 2022 so far, including mapping parts of the USA and some iD coding.",7

16234,"WN623","Mapping","SK53 [noted](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/SK53/diary/399392) that in a number of countries Bing imagery in the iD editor is very out-of-date (5 years old or more). This appears to be the result of a recent change in iD's code, and is [discussed](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/issues/9153) on GitHub.",7

16332","WN627","Mapping","Andrea Spinelli [wondered](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Andrea%20Spinelli/diary/399624) how to add a point of interest with iD at a specific coordinate. 16329","WN627","Software","Benjamin Clark, from Meta, [shared](https://github.com/facebookincubator/RapiD/discussions/482) the 2022 development plans for MapWithAI's RapiD editor for OpenStreetMap in a GitHub project issue. It is open to comments and feedback.",7

column1: 16445,"WN631","Releases","Geospatial analytics provider [Kontur](https://kontur.io/) added the new [OpenStreetMap Road Completeness](https://www.kontur.io/blog/osm-road-completeness/) layer to their free emergency mapping dashboard, [Disaster Ninja](https://www.kontur.io/portfolio/disaster-ninja/). It helps to check if all roads are mapped in OpenStreetMap by showing the ratio of OSM road length to Facebook AI-detected road segments, find exactly where the gaps are, and go to the iD editor to fix them.",7

16443,"WN631","Programming","Paul Jeffrey [reported](https://github.com/osmandapp/OsmAnd/issues/15058) an issue about the OSMAnd app presumably 'leaking data about users' travel history' through a unique identifier. While true, it’s been explained that this randomly generated UUID is used solely to maintain fair usage of the servers’ resources when downloading maps and seemed to be already covered in the privacy policy.",7

16495,"WN633","Mapping","CasGroeningen [created](https://www.openstreetmap.org/changeset/125779486) the 10 billionth node ([10,000,000,000](https://www.openstreetmap.org/node/10000000000)) in OSM on 4 September. The node is part of a house in the city of Fort Collins, Colorado, United States. Interestingly, this node [caused](https://twitter.com/geofabrik/status/1566763301350014977) problems with some of the Geofabrik's free shapefiles. This is because the Geofabrik .dbf file limits the ID length to 10 digits, while this node has an ID length of 11 digits.",7

16546,"WN634","Software","An easter egg can be [found](https://ideditor.org/IDEDITOR.NFO) on the ideditor.org website : an [information](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.nfo) file named IDEDITOR.NFO, with a 1 April 1994 [timestamp](https://ideditor.org) and a [Chmod 4162 permission](https://chmodcommand.com/chmod-4162/), referencing the [Warez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warez_scene) subculture.",7

16588,"WN635","Software","The RapiD development team at Meta [blogged](https://developers.facebook.com/blog/post/2022/08/25/preview-our-next-generation-osm-editor-rapid-2-point-0/) about an 'early preview' of RapiD 2.0 alpha, an OSM editor with access to AI-generated open data. The big change is a rewrite of the graphics engine to improve overall performance. They are asking for feedback via GitHub, Slack or Facebook.",7
16659,"WN637","Open Data","Martijn van Exel [explained](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/mvexel/diary/400035) how he uses the RapiD tool to add data from free and open sources to OSM.",7

16633,"WN637","Releases","iD editor version 2.22.0 has been [released](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/releases/tag/v2.22.0). You can find the changelog [here](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/blob/release/CHANGELOG.md#2220).",7

17027,"WN647","OSM in the media","The student media group _Megabyte_  [wrote](https://mbradio.ru/publication/4589) :RU-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://mbradio-ru.translate.goog/publication/4589?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN), in an article on the benefits of AI, about the RapiD editor, which has helped the HOT project.",7

17069,"WN649","Programming","Paul Norman let us [know](https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/12/28/upcoming-downtime-on-2023-01-22/) that the API database servers will be unavailable on Sunday 22 January 2023 between [10:00 and 15:00 UTC](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=OSM+API+down+time&iso=20230122T10&ah=5) due to maintenance. Map editing (using iD, JOSM, etc), and replication updates will be paused during that period. Login to services that require osm.org authentication may be also unavailable.",7

17127,"WN651","Mapping","Quite Frankly is [embarking](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Quite%20Frankly/diary/400700) on a project to 'document and update cycle lanes on every street in Melbourne and eventually Victoria in as much detail as possible' using tagging schemes that he says were developed specifically for the detailed documentation of [cycling infrastructure](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Berlin/Verkehrswende/Radwege) :DE-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://wiki-openstreetmap-org.translate.goog/wiki/Berlin/Verkehrswende/Radwege?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN). Other tools being used: [StreetComplete](https://github.com/streetcomplete/StreetComplete), iD, [JOSM](https://josm.openstreetmap.de/), [Vespucci](https://vespucci.io/) and Hauke Stieler's [Simple Task Manager](https://github.com/hauke96/simple-task-manager).",7

17331,"WN656","Events","About a year ago, Martin Raifer started working as the maintainer of the iD editor for the OSMF (we [reported](https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/14968#wn590_25838) earlier). He has [blogged](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/tyr_asd/diary/400974) a short recap and outlook of what’s lying ahead according to him. He wants to host regular online community sessions to chat about the iD editor. The first of these [chats](https://osmvideo.cloud68.co/user/mar-ljx-3qx-58s) will take place on [20 February at 4 pm UTC](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=iD%20monthly%20meetup&iso=20230220T1600) with the topic 'the state of the tagging presets – recent changes and development tips'.",7

17660","WN666","Mapping","Anton Khorev was happily surprised to [find out](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Anton%20Khorev/diary/401385) that iD also worked on his mobile phone. In order to optimise the experience, he advises directly opening the respective frame ([https://www.openstreetmap.org/id](https://www.openstreetmap.org/id) instead of the usual [https://www.openstreetmap.org/edit?editor=id](https://www.openstreetmap.org/edit?editor=id)) which spares you losing space to the navigation bar.",7

column1: 17658,"WN666","Community","Anne-Karoline Distel [wrote](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/b-unicycling/diary/401393) about how the OpenStreetMap community actively responded to the idea of mapping milk churn stands (we [reported](https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/16399#wn662_28338) earlier). In particular, the number of these objects mapped in Finland significantly increased after the collaboration of users houtari and Jyrki Kokko – Finnish milk churn stands are very much a [thing](https://kotiliesi.fi/ihmiset-ja-ilmiot/nostalgia/maitolaituri/) [fi]>>>[:EN-t:](https://kotiliesi-fi.translate.goog/ihmiset-ja-ilmiot/nostalgia/maitolaituri/?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN). [Discussion](https://github.com/openstreetmap/id-tagging-schema/issues/869) is ongoing about creating a dedicated preset for the iD editor, to make it easier for beginners to map milk churn stands.",7

17973,"WN676","Mapping campaigns","[Obianinulu](http://hdyc.neis-one.org/?Obianinulu) [reported](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Obianinulu/diary/401850) on a two-day training course, held at the University of Nigeria in Enugu, on using the iD Editor and Tasking Manager.",7

18100,"WN679","Software","Kamil Monicz [asked](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/discussions/9760) why the backlog of pull requests for iD appears to be so large. iD's maintainer, Martin Raifer, explained that the review process takes much effort even for a simple change, and it is not possible to quickly review every suggestion, so he needs to prioritise them. These pending proposals are simply lower priority.",7

18133,"WN680","Mapping","une abeille [explained](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/une%20abeille/diary/402005)  why they map pavements (sidewalks) as separate ways and provided step-by-step details on how to map pavements in iD.",7

18154,"WN681","Did you know that …","... that the [UN Maps Learning Hub](https://mappers.un.org/learning/), the UN's OSM self-learning platform available in six languages, offers quizzes in its [OSM Basics course](https://mappers.un.org/learning/course/view.php?id=25) to test your knowledge of OSM fundamentals, the iD and JOSM editors, topographic imagery and rendering, the OSM Tasking Manager and the mapping of certain features (places, residential areas, road networks and hydrography)? Give it a try and no worries, the correct answers are provided at the end if you don't know.",7

18232,"WN684","Software","Ben Clark [announced](https://github.com/facebook/Rapid/discussions/993) the release of [Rapid](https://rapideditor.org/edit) version 2.1 that includes two new features that will bring more attention to map data gaps:
-  A 3D building renderer in an inset map
- The ability to load and visualise more custom data with protomaps MPTiles support.",7
18260,"WN684","Releases","Mapilio street-level images are now [integrated](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/blob/release/CHANGELOG.md#camera-street-level) into the OpenStreetMap iD Editor.",7

18321,"WN686","Mapping","Black Diamond [shared](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Black_Diamond/diary/402337) his experience of using [USGS 3D Elevation](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/USGS_3D_Elevation_Program) data, which is available as a background layer in iD and JOSM for most US territories, to more easily map geographic features.",7

18390,"WN688","Did you know that …","... that you can quickly draw complex curved lines in iD by [pressing](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/ID/Shortcuts#Modifying_objects) the space bar and just moving the mouse? There is a [FastDraw](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/JOSM/Plugins/FastDraw) plugin for the same feature in JOSM.",7
18532,"WN692","Mapping","Rtnf [discussed](https://en.osm.town/@rtnf/111274198033393674) several benefits of a systematic cataloguing of OSM object IDs on the OSM Wiki.",7

column1: 20475,"WN737","Education","Marcos Dione had an OpenStreetMap [editing](https://en.osm.town/@mdione/113061632508819348) session with his kids and later asked if there was a staging tool for parents to review and correct their children's edits. 20541,"WN738","Software","Pedro Leão [summarised](https://forum.openhistoricalmap.org/t/formatted-citations-in-openhistoricalmap-gsoc-2024/280) his Google Summer of Code project, during which he added new field types to OpenHistoricalMap’s fork of the iD editor, helping mappers to cite their sources more rigorously.",7

20733,"WN743","Mapping","There are several useful tutorials on iD editor and JOSM in Japanese. For example, Kisaragi's [tutorial](https://qiita.com/KisaragiEffective/items/ce011b06c575066cefee) :JA-s: >>> [:EN-t:](https://qiita-com.translate.goog/KisaragiEffective/items/ce011b06c575066cefee?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) on how to split an area on OpenStreetMap using the iD editor and Kohei Otsuka's [guide](https://qiita.com/kochizufan/items/fe3c5163e6c0f4d2d1ed) :JA-s: >>> [:EN-t:](https://qiita-com.translate.goog/kochizufan/items/fe3c5163e6c0f4d2d1ed?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) to splitting and joining OSM objects in JOSM.",7

20732,"WN743","Community","Valerie Norton has [expressed](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/valhikes/diary/405313) frustration about people mapping remote areas by guesswork, perhaps prompted by the iD editor's listing of 'issues' in yellow.",7

20920,"WN747","Software","Daniel Schep [introduced](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/dpschep/diary/405539) 'Ultra v3' (formerly Overpass Ultra), an enhanced mapping tool that now functions as a MapLibre GL JS IDE. New features include query providers for multiple GIS file formats, auto-sorting of map style directives, bundled icon sprite sheets, fallback glyphs, and an HTML control for adding map titles and custom controls, extending Ultra's utility for geospatial queries and map customisation.",7

20987,"WN749","Community","Pieter Vander Vennet [highlighted](https://en.osm.town/@pietervdvn/113545933237913459) a collaborative ecosystem of OpenStreetMap tools, as shown in Paul Dassori's screenshot from Valdivia, Chile. The iD editor displays orange dots representing locations with images available via Panoramax, a federated system integrating Panoramax.xyz, Panoramax MapComplete, and contributions from MapComplete users like Awo, showcasing a rich dataset of geolocated photos.",7

21005,"WN749","Software","Martin Raifer [reflected](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/tyr_asd/diary/405686) on his State of the Map 2024 talk about improving the iD editor. Key points included addressing data complexity, supporting map maintenance with features such as the last checked date tagging, and making lifecycle mapping more intuitive. Collaborative efforts, such as Mattia's on lifecycle tagging, were highlighted alongside plans for the upcoming iD version 2.31 release. Future community chats are scheduled for Wednesday 4 December and Wednesday 8 January.",7

21047","WN750","Programming","Simon Poole's  [osm-area-tags](https://github.com/simonpoole/osm-area-tags) provides data on which OpenStreetMap tags imply that a closed way is an area, distinguishing between polygons and linear loops. The project supports improving tagging clarity by addressing cases where tags may imply both linear and area features. It builds on data from the iD editor's area definitions for enhanced mapping consistency.",7

column1: 21084,"WN751","Software","TrickyFoxy has [updated](https://en.osm.town/@foxy/113633788148829766) their script [better-osm-org](https://github.com/deevroman/better-osm-org/), adding a dark mode for iD, improving the changeset view mode by adding an edit war detector, searching for changesets by hashtags, and making values of `panoramax=` and `mapillary=` tags clickable. A detailed list of changes can be [found](https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/better-osm-org-a-script-that-adds-useful-little-things-to-osm-org/121670/8) on the OSM Community forum.",7

21265","WN755","Events","At the 38th Chaos Communication Congress held in Hamburg, the German OpenStreetMap community [hosted](https://www.fossgis.de/news/2025_01_02_38c3/) :DE-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://www-fossgis-de.translate.goog/news/2025_01_02_38c3/?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) an assembly within the 'Bits and Bäume' area. The team conducted workshops on iD and JOSM editors, facilitated OSM meetups, and held an 'ask-us-anything' session on data usage. Using FOSSGIS e.V.'s large-format printer, they created 54 custom A1 maps for participants. Additionally, stickers were distributed, and EUR 453 in donations was collected for OpenStreetMap-related activities.",7

column1: 21231,"WN755","Releases","Jochen Topf gave an [update](https://blog.jochentopf.com/2025-01-08-more-taginfo-news.html) on taginfo, introducing new features such as displaying a tag's status from the OSM wiki on key pages, highlighting inconsistencies, and a report for 'discardable' tags, such as those used by editors like iD and JOSM. Additional improvements include a CSV export option for tables, enhanced tools for wiki maintainers, and an interactive keyboard shortcut guide for experienced users.",7

21298,"WN756","OSM in the media","Wieland Breitfeld [shared](https://t.me/OSM_de/122965) :DE-s: a video recording from the 'MDR um 4' program, featuring interviews with several OpenStreetMap contributors. The segment highlighted various OSM-related mapping tools, including StreetComplete, the iD editor, and Wheelmap.",7
